Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphire, amazing all around.”
Reviews.Author: Avihovel
Reviews.Content: Been there last month on our honeymoon and loved every single second of our stay. Great breakfast with a variety of choices every day something else. The location is good is on the 5 eve between 38 and 40 street, it's just a bit far from all the commotion but it's 7 min walk. The hotel is very plesent, quiet, clean with a nice p small pool. But the main reason that I'm writing this review is a great person that work there that help us in a way I've never seen before in a hotel, her name is Paloma and she is amazing and helpful and kind in every situation. Best vacation we ever had!! Thank you Paloma!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Emily B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by friends who have stayed in Playa before. It was great in every way. The location is perfect for access to the beach and shopping/dining and still quiet. The staff went above and beyond in all categories. The breakfast ladies made breakfast to order with a smile. The outdoor terrace where breakfast is served is lovely. The desk staff helped us find great restaurants for dinner and helped with reservations for meals and other activities as well. The cleaning staff also were superlative. The room could use more space for sitting other than on your bed and a couple of drawers for storing clothing. But these are minor points. There were several nice places to sit outdoors to read or drink a beer and eat snacks if we wanted. The weather was always great so we did not really care about being in our room except to sleep. The craziness of 5th ave was close but not audible. We would recommend this hotel to couples who want a great value and service. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up!!”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel13
Reviews.Content: While we have vacationed in Playa many times, this is our first stay at Casa Ticul. We enjoy staying in north Playa, a more quiet, less frenetic area. We loved this hotel: nice size rooms with fridge & comfortable beds, updated bathroom with waterfall shower, thick towels, his/her bathrobes & slippers - which were a very nice touch. Breakfast,served roof-top, was wonderful, if not on the menu, just ask and they will gladly accommodate. Recommend you take advantage of the complimentary beach passes to Las Palapas, much less noisy and hectic than Mamitas. A convenience store right on the corner sells wine, beer and snacks, the restaurant Kool Fish will deliver food to the rooftop, or poolside making this another unique feature. Staff is friendly and always helpful. We will definitely be returning to this wonderful boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: AnnArborVino
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week in Playa del Carmen and we stayed here based on the TripAdvisor reviews. The good reviews area effect our experience. Here are some reasons to stay here: 1) Location! It's on 5ta Avenida, which is the main tourist drag in l,aya del Carmen, but it's at the quieter, less obnoxious end of the street. Bring comfy flip flops or shoes and the walk to the busy end isn't terrible--we did it several times. There's good food nearby, including some tasty restaurants (Pachamama, ComoComo, Luna Maya, Kool Fish, Drupas38, etc.), a cool little craft beer place (The Beer Club), and beach clubs. 2) Breakfast! Many reviews rave about breakfast, and they're right. Three wonderfully friendly women run the rooftop breakfast service. There is fresh squeezed juice, breads, fresh fruit, yogurt, and a good selection of breakfast main courses (omelette, pancakes, quesadillas, and a daily special that changes). Don't forget to tip them a little something each time or give them a big tip at the beginning. They deserve it. 3) Helpful concierge/registration staff! The women who rotate at te front desk were helpful. They had good recommendations, helped us rent a car to go to Coba, and always asked us about our day. 4) Free beach club access! We only went to two of the three options. We really liked Las Palapas. They provide towels and there's no drink/food consumption minimum. We got there early and got a good spot and our service was great. We also went to Mamitas, which we didn't like. They don't give you towels here, so you have to vring them from te hotel. Awful service, crowded, loud music... it wasn't at all comfortable or relaxing. Canibal Royale is the third option which we didn't try. It's a good place to go if you want old since they have a minimum food/drink consumption limit. 5) Housekeeping staff! Every day we had a new work of towel art on our bed. It made coming back to the room fun (and funny). 6) Purified water! They have purified water cookers on each floor. You can fill up bottles or your glasses, which saves you money on buying bottled water. Of course, if you want bottled water there's a little store at the end of the block--very close. 7) The door guy! He's always smiling and so polite. My only complaints are the plumbing and complimentary toiletries. 1) The plumbing. If you try to take a shower when other people on lower floors are also showering, expect no water. The shower went dry when I was trying to shower at 8 one morning. 2) the complimentary shampoo and conditioner aren't great. Bring your own or buy it there. It made my hair feel icky. Overall this place is great. It's a good home base for exploring this area--close to Tulum, Cozumel, Coba, etc. The rates make it especially great. Casa Ticul was great. (PS - I have a horrible bed bug phobia and search every room I stay in. I searched our room pretty thoroughly. Our room was bed bug free--found absolutely no physical evidence of them and received no bites over 6 nights in our room--Room #8.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Non-Resort Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Brian T
Reviews.Content: Much of our friends and families like to do the all-inclusive vacations and rarely leave the resort. We wanted the opposite: a comfortable, affordable hotel with good location to jump off to lots of different activities. Casa Ticul was perfect. The staff were very helpful, the room was clean, and the price was perfect. Our family spends a lot of time on the south end of 5th ave (low street numbers). We spent nearly our whole week nearer to the north side. What a complete difference. Our side is full of restaurants with very high ratings on trip advisor, lots of small shops, etc. The other side has all the huge stores and the less memorable restaurants. There is no burger king on our side! Mexican breakfast on the roof was tasty, although a bit inconsistent. A few days they had super tasty yogurt drinks and we really missed the rest of the time where they didn't. Wifi took a bit of doing to get working but once it worked it was great. Front desk staff are there 24/7 and are very eager to help. The rooms are not huge. I found the feather pillows uncomfortable. The pool is very small, but we are not pool people so that was ok. Basically, it was a great jumping off place and a great place to end up in the evening. So many great restaurants and activities near by. We would stay here again even if we were not on a budget, but I might splurge and buy a pillow at Mega to be more like home.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: zorripa
Reviews.Content: Central but quiet at night. Close to the beach (passes for 3 different beach clubs). Very confortable bed and well equiped bedrooms. Excellent breakfast on the nice rooftop terrace. Always smiling staff ready to help at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, zen, boutique hotel with everything you need included in best quiet spot in town.”
Reviews.Author: Giannakosta
Reviews.Content: Best place for your dollar, the lobby very nice with antique furniture with a modern twist beautiful. The rooms are a good size with comfy bed sheets, super clean and well decorated . They have a nice breakfast included on the beautiful rooftop terrace . Also, you have vouchers for mamitas beach club included and wifi in rooms for free. The little things are what makes this hotel nice; On each floor there are water machines with purified water that you can refill your bottles. The check inn is smooth and friendly. Best place for your money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gives You Everything Except A Beach View”
Reviews.Author: LittleMy001
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing boutique hotel property! The decor is a modern aesthetic with Mexican accents. You get a good-sized, clean room with premium toiletries (handmade soaps, quality shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, after-sunburn lotion, mosquito repellant lotion), a blow dryer, lightweight waffle-cotton robes and slippers. There is a lovely small pool in the courtyard of the property, a little bigger than a lap pool, with chairs and tables around it. This place makes the most out of every inch for services and ambiance! A fantastic hot breakfast of eggs, pancakes, waffles, omlettes, etc all cooked to order, as well a variety of fresh-squeezed juices, fresh fruit, cereal, breads, and terrific coffee or espresso (which is just a more concentrated version of the coffee it appears, but a big cup of it!) is served from 8-10:30 on their super-pretty rooftop terrace that overlooks a quieter section of Fifth Avenue. Lots of umbrellas and sail shades are there so you won't roast to death in the sun. Big electric fans help out when it is too much of a scorcher. The location is on a developing area of Fifth that has terrific restaurants and a corner store on the same small block. The pedestrian area starts two blocks away to the south. While they are not on the beach, they will still give you a complimentary towel/drink on one of 3 beach clubs in PDC, (Canibal Royal, Mamitas, and one other that I can't remember right now) so you can still enjoy the beach every day. The hotel staff is nothing short of wonderful and helpful, and even speak English. My only regret is that we only spent 2 nights there before moving on...

Reviews.Title: “Casa Ticul- pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Hanisland
Reviews.Content: Casa Ticul is really nice small boutique hotel. Good location, but not in the middle of all the bars and hassel. we had a junior suite with balcony which was really nice. Room was big enough and bed was excellent. Breakfast in the roof was great and the girls in service were really nice and friendly. You get free entry for 3 beach clubs and also towels to use in beach. I can recommend this hotel to every body who doesn't care of big hotel complex and all inclusive. Would go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “close to all shops”
Reviews.Author: Ewelinka87
Reviews.Content: Great location (on 5th Avenue): close to all shops, restaurants, nearly beach front (2 mins walking), very clean rooms. We loved shower too. That was the best shower since we've started travelling (4 week now). Staff very helpfull and breakfast in magic place on the roof. Loved it and would stay again. If you are looking for big resort full of turists that is not the place to stay. But if you are looking for Mexical place to stay go for it! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: We got stuck in a huricane and ended up in Playa for a couple extra days. We decided to leave our big all inclusive hotel farther from town and stay here at Casa Ticul. We really enjoyed the stay. The price was right and the location was perfect for being away from the beach. The receptionist was awesome and got us reservations at a restaurant and had several other restaurant sugestions that worked out great. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Allen D
Reviews.Content: I was in town for my daughter's wedding. Casa Ticul is close to the beach-4 min walk. Reasonably priced. Bright airy rooms.Very friendly staff. The food ladies in the rooftop kitchen can cook'em up. Real nice. Start the day off with good food. Meet some of your fellow guests. At least 10 were here for the wedding. Felt like I was at someone's house.Kinda cool. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to land in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: marybanilow
Reviews.Content: We had an incredibly nice stay at Casa Ticul. It had everything you could ask for: clean rooms, welcoming and helpful staff, and a really nice complimentary breakfast served on the rooftop deck. More than anything, I liked the design of the hotel. Everywhere were little details that really showed that someone with great taste took the time to make it a pleasant place to be. Another thing I ended up liking about the hotel was its location. I was a little concerned that it was so far at the end of Avenida 5, but that ended up being a positive feature. In the years since I had last been to Playa del Carman, the town has exploded in size, and down on the main drag it gets a little Cancunish and mall-like... and overpriced. Casa Ticul inhabits a spot that feels a little like the Playa del Carmen I remember: still plenty of restaurants and bars and the other amenities, but somehow, friendlier, hipper and more reasonably priced. And if you need to go to Little Cancun down the road, it's an easy pleasant walk. One small small complaint: the wifi is nearly useless in the rooms. Dear Casa Ticul: if you're reading this, please get some routers!!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Ticul was just what we wanted!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kellymay_7
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on trip advisor reviews. I was very glad I did. It was exactly as advertised and the price was great!. The room was big, nicely decorated and the bed was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in while traveling, The staff was pleasant, extremely helpful and never obtrusive. The transportation that the hotel provides for a fee, is worth every penny, especially because Playa del Carmen is approx 1 hour from the airport. The hotel is right at the beginning of 5th avenue, so there is a walk into town, which I enjoyed! The key attribute of this hotel is the breakfast every morning. I wasnt sure if we would get enough to eat for the day trips we planned on taking, but was pleasantly surprised that it actually was a full breakfast. The trio of ladies that make this happen are extrememly efficient and friendly. We never waited over 10 minutes for our meals. There was a different special everyday, but the last day was my favorite, the omelette poblano. It was amazing! This saved us a ton of money and was a great way to start the day. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definately stay here again. You can not get a better bargain for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great People”
Reviews.Author: quickpix
Reviews.Content: Another visit to this fine Hotel. The management is so friendly. You must make a destination pick. Love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “such a nice place!”
Reviews.Author: jandmalberta
Reviews.Content: We chose casa ticul based on the reviews and were not disappointed. The jr suite is beautifully decorated and inviting and the bed was very comfy. Paloma and Felix go above and beyond, and the breakfast girls upstairs do a fantastic job! casa ticul is close to5th ave, and only a short walk to the beach clubs. The only downfall was the noise from the neighboring nightclubs.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in the heart of Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Angela_The_Traveller
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel. It's far enough away to drown out the sounds of the late night bars but close enough to walk home from them. They provide really really great service, they arranged a transport for us at a very reasonable to and from the airport. There is none of that "working for the tip" feeling, it's 100% genuine. There is free wi-fi, very good toiletries and a range of them. The only disadvantages are, our room had a distinct damp smell, no mould or anything it was very clean, just the smell. Also, there is no phone in the rooms. Only a small pool is available, but there is a nice roof top. Why use the pool when the beach is free and gorgeous. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and parents.

Reviews.Title: “It would be a great hotel, if it wasn't so noisy”
Reviews.Author: YupiYey
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, this place it's clean, new and would be a great value. The only problem they have, is that the walls are too thin, you can hear everything that happens around the hotel (People talking in the next room, the construction workers from across the street and even the cleaning ladies yapping in the hallway) All those noises woke us up at 8 in the morning, so if you don't mind being awake at that time, or going to sleep after the restaurants nearby closes, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Good vibe”
Reviews.Author: dillio
Reviews.Content: Pros Great staff Very clen Great rooftop and breakfast(gratis) Incredible shower Perfect bed Unique appointments Con First floor can get noisy during the day Great little place

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dumplingmx
Reviews.Content: Unless you want to be on the beach, this is one of the best locations to stay in PDC. It's on 5th Avenue, the busy tourist street, but it's at the north quiet end of the street. This means you can walk to restaurants and shops and you can also walk to the beach, but you don't have to run the gauntlet of souvenir sellers as soon as you step out of your hotel. The hotel has arrangements with three different beach clubs, we tried all three beaches and preferred the one at La Palapa, but the food at Canibal Royal was pretty good and Mamitas is closer to the busy area of 5th Avenue. It's nice to have a choice. Breakfast on the roof was always good, they usually offered freshly made omelets or other egg dishes, and there was juice and fruit and home made bread. And the coffee was good. The girls making breakfast were a pleasure to deal with, always cheerful and quick to respond to requests. We tipped them at the beginning of our week's stay so we wouldn't have to remember to bring money up to the terrace, and they remembered us and treated us like old friends every morning. Our only complaint about the hotel is that the rooms are very small and the hotel itself is also very small. However the hotel is well designed and makes use of every bit of space, but if anyone is making noise in the hallways or the pool area it travels (we don't use AC and like to keep our windows open). Fortunately there is a no children policy so the hotel is quieter than it would be if families were staying. The wi-fi is fine in the lobby, not so good in the rooms (we were in number 11). The staff is very very helpful. The breakfast staff, the housekeepers, the receptionists, all were extremely friendly. They know the area well and have lots of good advice and suggestions. We sent our laundry out when we were there and the staff took care of all the arrangements to have it picked up and delivered, then after it came back we realized my husband had left a chain and medal in his shorts pocket. As soon as we told them the front desk sent someone with my husband to talk to the laundry staff, the owner of the laundry was notified, and the woman who had been in charge of doing the wash produced the chain. She had no intention of keeping it, she had put it away for safe keeping. It was a wonderful ending to an incident that could have been distressing, since the medal is from Russia and irreplaceable. We had a long talk with the owner of the laundry who turned out to be an interesting guy. We would stay here again and would recommend it to friends. Playa del Carmen is too touristy for me, but if I came back and wanted a place to use as a base for day trips I would definitely choose this hotel just for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: TERI B
Reviews.Content: A very nice, clean hotel away from the noise other areas of 5th Ave are in the middle of. The staff were all very nice and helpful. Our room was very comfortable and clean. The complimentary breakfast each morning, on the rooftop, was really good and included fresh squeezed juice. The two ladies preparing it were very attentive and pleasant. They also offered free internet service in the lobby. I was able to check my e-mails and contact someone at home, which was appreciated, since I don't use a laptop and my cell phone didn't work there. We were also given complimentary passes to a very nice beach club nearby and had a nice lunch and some beer there. It also had a lot of shade umbrellas, since we do not like too much at once. We highly recommend this hotel, but if you are not able to walk up a lot of stairs or require handicapped access, it may be difficult to maneuver around. There are some very good restaurants in the area and the staff is helpful when you ask about them. When we go back to Playa we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: tpgc1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night at Casa Ticul, on our way to staying in Punta Soliman to stay in a Hacienda. The place is on 5th avenue, but not in the middle of things. It is where you can drive on 5th, so there is a lot less drunkeness going on, and I personally think that's a good thing. We had a great reception, they were expecting us, the room was super cute, and very clean. The bed was nice too. For breakfast word had gotten around we were in Mexico for our wedding, so the staff made us love pancakes (which my now husband couldn't eat since he's a Celiac) that were very tasty (I ate them), and then they gave us a keychain to remember them by. It was nice, warm and I'd be happy to go back.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful little place”
Reviews.Author: t-wyliecoyote
Reviews.Content: My husband and I always stay away from the large resorts and all inclusives. In our travels we have stayed and some wonderful little places. Casa Ticul is one of those. The hotel is small, with great free breakfast. The rooms are spotless, the employees are so helpful and kind. It was a wonderful experience, close to most everything. Great ac, shower pressure and pool. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: MaureenR50
Reviews.Content: The personnel was very friendly. The room was beautiful and comfortable. It was always clean. Breakfast was very good. I enjoyed it and I will go back to the same hotel soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Sonia1302
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only rated 3 star but compared to other 3 star places around I would give it a 4 to 5 star. Rooms are very clean. Beds are super comfy (which can be hard to find in Playa). They are also king size. The rooms have a ceiling fan, air con, huge T.V and a little bar fridge. The hotel is at the bottom of 5th St, so right near all the action but not too close to be really noisy. The pool is small but sufficient and very clean. It’s only a very short walk to the beach. The breakfast in amazing. Not a lot of choice but everything they have on offer is fresh. They serve breakfast on their roof top terrace which is gorgeous. This is an adult’s only boutique hotel, although there was a family with 2 kids staying there but I only saw them once. Wifi is also available and included in the room charge. The staff are friendly and speak English. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...”
Reviews.Author: Lggcf
Reviews.Content: Very nice for the price, very clean, outstanding staff. Breakfast was good , the girls at breakfast terrace were awesome , did everything to accommodate our request always with a smile. At the end of 5th ave, quiet, short walk to the beach ( 5 min). The hotel provide beach club acces to 3 diferent places. We stay at las palapas, they provide beach chairs, towels and umbrella. Quite, clean,nice beach, you could walk to mamitas beach club which is also provide by casa ticul. Mamitas is more hip, younger crowd ,techno music playing all the time, beach beds,umbrellas. My first time visiting playa del Carmen, thanks for a great experience casa ticul...

Reviews.Title: “Best place ever!”
Reviews.Author: kirstyjane
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here over the Xmas period. Absolutely loved it. Easy stroll into town. Basic breakfast on the rooftop. Never used the pool as went to to the beach every day. Quiet, relaxing stay, never saw cleaning staff but room was always clean on our return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonuga
Reviews.Content: This one is great boutique hotel. It's clean, staff are friendly, the pool is nice and rooftop terrace is great for breakfast (where they will make pancakes or waffles for you). The hotel is a 2 minute walk from the beach and they have agreements with beach clubs and hotels so you can use their towels, parasols, etc... for free. This looks like a much more expensive hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again if I were to return to Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel close enough to everything you want”
Reviews.Author: dichosa
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay if you want to be close enough to the Quinta but far enough away to have more of a tranquil experience. We frantically had to find a new hotel after not being able to sleep after our first night at In Fasion due to noise. Thank you Trip Advisor. Two great little Mexican Cafes right across the street. The new Italian place is excellent around the corner, it is cheap and authentic, eat there for sure. La Portena also is a great place to eat along the sidewalk. This hotel is clean, great price, great hair dryer, they even have a dvd player they will loan to you. The breakfast is okay, not substantial, but it is included in the rate. They even give you mosquito repellent in the little bottles along with shampoo, etc. nice touch. I visited many hotels in playa this trip, some smell like mold, some are too close to discotecas, some are too family friendly, some are just old. This hotel is perfect although the wireless internet could use some more investment. We had to keep the laptop along the far side of one window for it to work. Another wireless router would be nice. There was one little difficulty, we were give the wrong rate per a phone conversation. I recapped the discussion afterwards via email and received confirmation. After we had unpacked and were pleased with the hotel, a different person informed me that the rate was incorrect that was given to me and tried to talk about a new rate. The resolution was fine after a few days the manager honored the rate give to me for the days we stayed and were not able to resolve the situation, due to her absense. She explained to me that the employee was new and made a mistake, it happens, i ended up paying a little more for the rest of the stay, i was fine with that. After taking a tour of the top ten hotels on trip advisor I believe this hotel is in the top two for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A superb boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: AVDS231
Reviews.Content: We are a Dutch couple (28 & 30 years old) who went to Casa Ticul for their honeymoon. We really enjoyed our stay at this beautiful boutique hotel. We had a standard king room that was perfect. The mattress and the pillows were really comfortable. Bed size was perfect. The cleanliness of the room was really good. Large bathroom with a rainshower. We had new towels (daily they made funny towel-art) and sheets everyday. The pool is OK, not really big, but perfect to have quick refreshing dip. The service of the hotel was perfect, nice friendly staff (except the guy who was there on our day of arrival). The location is good, settled on a quiet part of the 5th avenue. 5 minute walk to the beginning of the vibrant part of the 5th. 15 minute walk to the bus station on the 5 th, perfect if you want to explore all the tourist attractions on your own (saves you money as well). 8 minute walk to Mamitas Beach club (beds and parasol free of charge for Casa Ticul guests. Don't forget to ask for a voucher at the reception of the hotel). The breakfast at Casa Ticul was really nice, daily fresh squeezed juices (The pineapple & mint juice was the best!!) There was also a daily Mexican breakfast special which was good as well. Only thing that disappointed us was the day of arrival. We actually hoped for a bit of extra service because it was our honeymoon (the hotel knew it was our honeymoon). For example a romantic decorated room when you arrive or at least someone who helps you carry your 3 suitcases up to your room. My wife and I had to drag our suitcases up the stairs (not cool after travelling for 12 hours) while the male employee was sitting behind his desk doing nothing. Maybe a thing to consider for Casa Ticul. And a WIFI range extender for the hotel would make things really perfect. Besides these small downsides, Casa Ticul is a perfect place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Very Ticul”
Reviews.Author: PDHayden
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay with Casa Ticul and I will definitely be back. Here are my top 5 reasons why I enjoyed my stay at Casa Ticul. 1. Great Staff...Service Oriented and Friendly...I have very high expectations and they met and exceeded them. 2. Great Location...Upper end of 5th avenue, away from all the hustle and bustle, but still very close to the beach, restaurants and shopping. 3. Modern and Hip decor with a good amount of amenities...complimentary breakfast, complimentary beach passes, use of the upper deck for you and your guest to enjoy sunsets. 4. Most Comfortable and Plush beds that I have experienced in the Riviera Maya. 5. A very well maintained property, with cold a/c, your fridge for your own refreshments and very clean. This hotel is a very good value for what it has to offer, I travel quite a bit and in this economy I think you get a big bang for you buck or peso with Casa Ticul. Casa Ticul is Very Ticul with 2 thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Great value! It largely exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: MateoBB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great experience at Casa Ticul – it largely exceeded our expectations. The two main points are their focus on details and helpfulness of the receptionists. The mattress was great (comparable to a 5 star hotel), they offered Mexican breakfasts and varied them daily, and according to my wife the decoration and finishing was really good (I am an engineer and she is an interior designer  ) The second great point was the staff – they were really helpful suggesting us activities and tours. When we had a problem with a tour that they suggested, they were particularly active trying to help us to solve the problem. Probably the only downside was the location, about 5 to 10 minutes’ walk from the part of the main street with the most activity. At the same time, it was nice to be on a quitter location.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: brandonroman
Reviews.Content: Nice place, close to the beach and the main street, and good breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be a better place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LordNottingham
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Casa Ticul when we went to Playa for a friend's wedding. The wedding was at one of the huge resorts at the southern end of town, and we definitely got the better deal!! Casa Ticul is very personal because of the small number of rooms. We got to know the front desk staff fairly well and even saw one of them on 5th Avenue a few times. Our room was very clean, and very well appointed. The breakfast on the roof patio was amazing and definitely got the day started off right. Also, the passes to Mamita's beach were wonderful and helped us spend a relaxing day on the beach. The hotel staff also helped us book our tour of Tulum and Coba, which were both great. The only thing that wasn't 100% awesome was that the wi-fi did not reach into our room; however, the computers in the lobby worked well and I try not to be completely connected when I'm on vacation anyway! All in all, a great place to stay and enjoy Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant design, friendly service, best part of Avenida Quinta”
Reviews.Author: bboyneko
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 4 nights but loved it here so much. The shower is ultra modern with a rainfall shower head, they have wonderful toiletries including even mosquito repellent (I didnt notice any mosquitos however) and a nice TV. The WiFI was easy to use and fairly fast, although sometimes I had to stand near the window to get a good signal. The room has a fan and a good air conditioning unit, we turned off the air conditioning everytime we left the room for the day yet it was always nice and cool in the room. I saw other guests just left their windows open to allow the breeze in. The mini bar has very reasonably prices, $1 water, $1.50 gatorades. This was the first time in my life I actually helped myself to the minibar since it was reasonably priced. The breakfast on the rooftop is so wonderful. There are plenty of seats, plenty of shade, and plenty of options. The room cleaning was always great, we'd come back to really intricate towel sculptures. It seemed the more we tipped the more amazing the sculpture, it was fun! They give you coupons for free chairs and umbrellas at Mamitas beach club. I highly recommend you go there, its on a great spot on the beach, has a great bar and restaurant or they bring the food to your chair. Try the fried fish, its good. Try and get there before noon, the chairs and beds fill up fast. The design of the hotel was genius, it allowed for the pool to remain in the shade almost the entire day, so that you always have a refreshing swim away from the intense sun beams of doom that are plentiful in that tropical part of mexico. They always played tasteful background music that seems to only be audible if you are in the pool area. It was always quiet, we never heard another room. The only sounds I ever heard was the weird tropical birds in the morning that live in that part of the world. This hotel is located in what I kept heard being called "The new avenida quinta". If you are familiar with SoFi in South Beach, the area south of 5th street in South Beach Miami, this part 5th street in Playa del carmen is very similar. I don't think any travel guide or forum I visited prepared me for how tacky and awful 5th street /avenida quinta is in terms of tourist trap hell. Thankfully Casa Ticul is in the very nicest part of Avenida Quinta, at the very northern end. Also I noticed even if I caught a cab on that part of 5th street, I never got charged tourist prices of 50 pesos for any distance. It was more in the 25-35 peso range per ride. There are two small tiendas (convenience stores) located right next to the hotel, making it very easy and very cheap to get whatever small things you need, from beer, wine, lighters, snacks, water to aquas frescas. The restaurants near the hotel are the best. You are a short cab ride from El Dogon for authentic Tacos al Pastor, or a stone throw away from excellent steaks at El Facon, best breakfast at La Cueva del Chango, best small dive bar/lounge Casa Rosa, and best Mojitos and salsa dancing at La Bodeguita del Medio. This is the absolute best part of Playa del Carmen, there is no doubt. One tip: don't use the ATM right outside the hotel, it charges a large fee. Instead take a cab to a ATM located around 30th street for the best rates. I used Santander bank near the MEGA on 30th. Also the hotel offers many convenient tours. We did not use them for this, but they seemed to have many options at good prices. They have a nice computer area near the front desk if you want to check your email or the weather or whatever you need. It seems the front desk staff speaks good english and gives great advice for what to do or where to eat. The only downside is it is adult only, no kids allowed, so if you are looking for a family hotel this is not the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: JenChi83
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip to Playa Del Carmen in April to plan our upcoming wedding on a travel site that gave us an awesome deal. The deal was so great, we were extremely worried the hotel selection was going to be horrendous. To our surprise, Casa Ticul was the highlight of our weeklong trip. The hotel is located on 5th avenue about a 5 minute walk from the busy part of 5th avenue but it seems like its a world away. The hotel is located in a calmer residential area that was perfect for our group which consisted of 4 people in their late 20s and my parents who are in their late 50s. I had not been to Playa Del Carmein in a couple of years and to say it has changed from the charming quiet town i remember is the understatement of the year. There are gift shop employees that hound you down the minute they spot you, casa ticul was a welcome refuge after a busy/noisy stroll. The pool is small but was great to cool off in after a long day at the beach. the rooms are modern looking with great beds and thoughful toiletries like aloe vera gel and bug repellant provided. The breakfast was a great spread of fruit, juices, bread, and eggs. the breakfast is served on the terrace of the hotel which is covered with umbrellas and feels at least 20 degrees cooler than the intense heat you feel when walking in Playa. If you're looking for a great resource, make sure you chat with Paola the young lady who works the front desk. Paola was extremely helpful and friendly, she set up most of our wedding meetings and provided us with a ton of information. We loved our stay at casa ticul and cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “So happy we stayed here”
Reviews.Author: chili11
Reviews.Content: We just returned home to Boston from a wonderful stay at Hotel Casa Ticul. I chose this hotel because of the reviews and I am glad I did. Everyone that works here is just wonderful, very kind and helpful. We felt welcome from the minute we walked through the door. This hotel is in a great neighborhood close to the best restaurants in the town. I loved getting up each morning and having a made to order breakfast on the roof deck. The warm smiles that greeted us each morning were worth getting up for, not to mention the fresh local eggs and cappucino! Corner store and laundry service were great too. This is a place where I will return again and again. ++very clean and comfortable, thanks to Hotel Casa Ticul and Nicolas our driver to and from airport. Everything was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent food, service, and location!”
Reviews.Author: Tim747
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two weeks at Casa Ticul late February and early March this year and we'll go back again. We've been to Islas Mujeres and Holbox, Tulum, and Playa del Carmen a number of times and this year decided to stay in a nicer hotel rather than make a low price the key thing. Casa Ticul is far enough north on Fifth Avenue that the noise and jostling is a few blocks away and you're, instead, in a pleasant little neighborhood that's quiet and not built up, yet. It feels more like Mujeres and Holbox and Tulum than Cancun. Wonderful little restaurants are within three to five blocks and recommendations from those at the front desk were superb--the less money the meal cost, the better their recommendations. We ate a number of dinners at a little two-table place about five blocks away where the chicken tamales hit the spot night after night, and the bill never came to more than 70 pesos (athough we'd leave 100). I spent my days writing up on the roof terrace where breakfast is served. During the day usually no one is up there and the tables and chairs plus loungers and view are perfect for privacy and work. Each day I'd go into the shower up there and wet down my shirt and shorts three or four times during the afternoon so the water would evaporate, cooling me. Breakfast is the highlight: the cooks are kind and willing to make whatever you'd like. Delightful breakfasts with scrumptious juices and food all cooked and served by the most kind and helpful women you can imagine. We tipped them but the breakfasts are free. The pool is clean and cool, but its placement is impracticable and it was almost never used. Three things could be improved: first, there's no small table and chairs in the room, so the only place to read or write or do e-mail is on the bed; second, the bed is wonderful, but it sits on top of a platform that makes getting on and off quite awkward; and third, internet connectivity would be much improved if they added a couple wireless routers--especially one on the roof. From the owners to the people who sorted the laundry on the roof each afternoon, everyone was polite, cheerful, and willing to help with any need. We had a delightful two weeks, walked everywhere, and thus got a lot of good exercise (no need for a car, here). We plan to go back. Thank you, Casa Ticul!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing little hotel, superb value, and great service!”
Reviews.Author: sfactor503
Reviews.Content: My husband and I headed to Playa Del Carmen for 3 days before heading to Tulum, and stayed at Casa Ticul. We don't like being in the middle of the chaos, so we loved that they are the much quieter end of 5th Ave. I realize it won't be like this for long with new development, but I don't like being in the middle of tourist chaos. We were only a 3-5 minute walk to the beach and easy walk to the busier part of 5th Ave. We were provided passes to Mammitas on the beach where we could get some shade. While Mammitas can be quite the scene, you can park it a little closer to the Mahekal Resort (we would love to stay there but it was over our budget). Either way it was the perfect amount of time for us in Playa Del Carmen. I don't know that I could of stayed a week as it was a getting redundant in town and too touristy on the beach. The rooms were very very clean - with AC - the only thing is I personally hate AC and the ceiling fan had only one speed (which almost blew us off the bed - a small laughing moment for us!). We were fortunate that it was not that hot in the nights so we kept the AC low. The bed was super comfortable and the room was well cared for. The bathrooms super clean! This is not a 5 star resort, but for us it was perfect. We are not the types who like all-inclusives with everything 'taken care of' - we are a bit more adventurous - so we really enjoyed this place. I can not brag enough about the breakfasts on the roof top! AMAZING! Sopas, Tortillas, Omelettes, amazing fruit, yogurt, granola and fresh squeezed juices! What a value. Our hotel in Tulum only offered toast and juice! We totally feel like we scored and were very happy about our choice to stay at Casa Ticul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic breakfasts, very helpful , eager to please”
Reviews.Author: happyguy070
Reviews.Content: One block from fabulous fish house where the locals line up for fresh seafood. Quiet end of 5th Ave and lots of interesting places within walking distance. Lovely decks to sit undisturbed for an evening drink and watch the pedistrian traffic from above. Kitchen girls make sure there is an abundance of fresh fruit and the cooked breakfasts are tasty and nicely presented. All employees are polite, seem to be happy in their work and do a good job.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, wonderful service & romantic rooms”
Reviews.Author: Himer
Reviews.Content: No issues at all, it was very clean, comfortable & quiet. It's a romantic place. I love it! I would like to be back ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff - Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer155042
Reviews.Content: We were on our way to a wedding at one of the larger hotels and needed a place to stay for one night. My husband went online and found this wonderful hotel! The staff was terrific, our rooms very comfortable, breakfast/lunch was great and the location was perfect - one or two blocks from the beach and right on the strip with all the restaurants, nightlife and shopping. If we go back to Playa del Carmen we would rather stay at Casa Ticul than one of the big all inclusives.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and charming- loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dfbeach
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights with my wife while on our honeymoon. It is located in a great part of Playa which is close, but not too close, to the main pedestrian walk on 5th Ave. Located in a safe neighborhood but still has enough local flare, and not too touristy. You won't have peddlers trying to sell you stuff outside the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms and amenities were clean. They even made up our room with rose petals despite us never telling them we were honeymooning! Also, the breakfasts on the rooftop terrace were fantastic! Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very charming hotel - will come back for sure !”
Reviews.Author: noogman
Reviews.Content: perfectly located at the end of the 5th Avenida - very close to the best beaches in PdC. Super friendly hotel staff. No question that I come back...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience: Very clean and comfortable with a friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: phillucky
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this place. The beds are super comfortable and the area very safe....away from the throngs of people on the other end of 5th Avenue. Within two blocks, you have a choice of great Mediterranean, Mexican, Sushi or excellent Cuban food. It's within 2 blocks of the beach and comes at an excellent price in a very upscale neighborhood. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Ticul is the best Playa has to offer”
Reviews.Author: o2bnecuador
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and it was amazing. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is good. This was my third time to Playa and this was by far my favorite place for the price. The pool is smallish but the hotel is located just a few blocks from the beach (and it's on the better end of the beach). They also have deals with two resorts on the beach that you can go to and use their lounge chairs. The best part--my fiance told them it was our anniversary and the staff made sure to make it extra special for us. I really would have given this hotel a million stars if I could have.

Reviews.Title: “Mexican Hospitality at its best!”
Reviews.Author: ninammay
Reviews.Content: Casa Ticul is an understated hotel in a quieter, yet cool area in Playa del Carmen. Staff is helpful, thoughtful and polite and the Mexican breakfast served at the top terrace, delicious! The rooms are clean, luminous and cozy, king size beds are amazing. Shower is big, warm, powerful. There are great restaurants and bar just around the corner, beach is two blocks away. Highly reccomended!ocha van de Put Nina Rocha van de Put

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MaleSolis
Reviews.Content: Very well located, good price and staff very nice and helpful. Good size rooms with soft beds, very clean. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “The best boutique hotel in a fantastic location with great service!”
Reviews.Author: panda11
Reviews.Content: Casa Ticul is our new home away from home. The location is in the best part of Playa del Carmen with a lot of new and trendy places to eat/ hang out. The beach is very close and the hotel provides passes for its guests. The breakfast on the terrace is amazing - the staff is great and the rooms are well designed and very comfortable. Great rain shower too! Parking is plentiful around the hotel, and a car is a must in the area to explore everything in the riviera. Can't wait to come back to casa ticul!!!

Reviews.Title: “3rd time's a charm”
Reviews.Author: amclaugh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned for the 3rd time to Casa Ticul..we love it THAT much! Some changes since our last visit in 2009: roof top deck has been converted to a breakfast area. Very charming and the breakfast menu went from continental to hot items as well. A huge plus, in our opinion! The staff was warm as usual and we really appreciated the free passes for umbrella/chairs and 10% discount off of food/drinks at Mamita's Beach club, which is a 10min leisure walk away. We highly recommend trying La Cueva de Chango just a few steps down from the hotel. The food is fresh and delicious with an ambience to match.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: vallorylucas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very near from the main places in Playa del Carmen, but at the same time is very quiet - excellent when you need to relax and don´t want to be bothered.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little get away”
Reviews.Author: janeshanky
Reviews.Content: Casa Ticul is a wonderful small hotel with very attentive and deightful staff. Mauricio was always helpful and friendly. Juliana and Veronica were equally delightful and made us delicious breakfasts every morning on the roof top. What a great way to start the day. The hotel is well located and just far enough away from the crowded downtown scene but close enough to be able to walk into town easily for dinner, drinks and music. Directly next door to the hotel is a great little place for fish (Kool Fish) and completely unpretentious. Tons of good restaurants to choose from. We thought that the Margaritas were best at Posada Freud on Fifth Avenue. The bartendar there, Augustine, intoduced us to several types of tequilla and Mexcal. It was always nice to come back to the hotel at the end of a long day. I would suggest that they install night lights on the roof top so that you can spend more time up there I tried reading my book but by 5ish it was already too dark to read.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: candijo
Reviews.Content: This was a great cozy and chic hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I traveled with my boyfriend and we both enjoyed the hotel. Both gentleman that worked at the front desk were very nice and informative. They recommended some great eating places, such as Babe's, and Aca los tacos. Both places were really good, thanks guys! Also loved the design of the hotel and the pool. I had a great time in Playa del carmen and a great stay at this hotel. Will definitely go back. Hasta pronto Casa Ticul!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, staff and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: KathyBC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose Casa Ticul as we wanted to avoid the big resorts and their reviews seemed to be excellent. We had never been to Playa del Carmen, but having travelled to other parts of Mexico, we knew that it was important to do your research. Casa Ticul delivered! The location is great - far enough away from the strip, but close enough to walk to it when you want to go shopping. There are many new buildings going up in the area and lots of great restaurants nearby. Paola was a great help booking a tour to Coba and Tulum, the breakfast on the roof was always delicious, the air conditioning worked very well and the bed was awesome! I would recommend the Jr. Suite for the space and the private balcony. The room was kept very clean and housekeeping never disturbed us when we were in the room. We loved the towel art! The only criticism I have is the hot water ... If we got up early, the water was only luke warm. We didn't mind as the weather was quite hot and humid (for us). We always had hot water in the afternoon after returning from our day. Thank you so much for your hospitality. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: DrunkenHobo
Reviews.Content: A hotel can be clean, good value and ideally located but all these things can be negated if the staff do not have the right attitude. Casa Ticul excels in all aspects it is possible to judge a hotel but where it really shines is the in dedication of its staff to ensuring guests have a pleasant stay. If I was in this part of the world again I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Playa”
Reviews.Author: robpatmore
Reviews.Content: Casa Ticul is tucked away at the right end of 5th Avenue - away for the noisy bars and tacky shops with aggressive hawkers. A string of new restaurants (go to Como Como for great Italian and Piola for a pizza) and cafe's have opened in this area which make it much more sophisticated than the rest of Playa. And it's easy to get to Mamitas beach club - another place to mingle with the locals. The hotel is beautifully done and the rooms nice - but pay the extra and get the Junior Suite as it's much better value with a balcony and sitting area. We were staying just as they were doing their annual maintenance and so things weren't perfect, but they're doing a good job and will be ready for December. There is a small pool on the ground floor but out of the sun and not really special - move it to the roof terrace and it would be. The only negative is the breakfast - lukewarm coffee, a few bits of fruit and toast - we had it once and then went over the road to the great cafe every day.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest little hotel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: honnybunny
Reviews.Content: I was really suprised when I arrived in that little hotel to spend 3 nights at Easter time 2010. It is beautifully decorated, the breakfast served on the hotel terrasse (on the roof) is the best in Playa. The beds are also the most confortable in Playa. I've been going there since 15 years and I know that sleeping quality is hard to find in Mexico. I really enjoyed my stay at that hotel with my boyfriend, it was really romantic and we always had the pool to ourself...we felt at home. I will definetly return and suggest that hotel to couples and people travelling by themself.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable value for money”
Reviews.Author: gilberta_swann
Reviews.Content: Cute, cozy and at an incredible prize. Our room looked nice and was very comfortable and the staff was extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: ayeug
Reviews.Content: I loved my bed. It was so easy to fall asleep. It is a great place to stay and I definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Jr. Suite is Nice”
Reviews.Author: Perfuzen
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ticul is just North of the nightlife of 5th Ave. So there is not as much noise at night as other hotels right on 5th Ave. but during the day (as of September 2010) there is alot of construction right across the street and the noise can get started early. At night it is a little dark that far north of 5th. Ave. but in a few years Hotel Ticul will be right in the heart of the action. It is not very close to the beach(at least 5 min walk), but they make up for that by giving you coupons at local beachfront resorts so you can use their umbrellas and beach chairs/cabanas. Overall: the rooms are nice and clean inside, staff are kind and helpful, the breakfast is very tasty and you can't beat the price. It would be perfect if it was right on the beach! Just a side note the resturaunt next door is HORRIBLE, old food and over priced, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant little hotel, amazing large rooms and wonderful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jono1981
Reviews.Content: We booked for two nights but ended up staying for four which says it all. The entire experience was an absolute pleasure. The rooms were large with a great shower and plasma TV. The continental breakfast was also great up on the rooftop. Its located about 300 hundred metres from the beach and you recieve subsidised beach chairs which was nice. Only small critisicm it that the pool area is very small but with the beach so close it is not a major issue.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Ticul - the way to go”
Reviews.Author: Emc3
Reviews.Content: Freindly, welcoming and knowledgable staff - generous rooms and great ammenities. Good location and excellent value for money - we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay while you visit the city and the parks around”
Reviews.Author: FedericoIX
Reviews.Content: It's a good alternative if you are planning to visit the diferent attractions of the Riviera Maya (Xel-Ha, Xcaret, Chichen-Itza and so on). The bed was amazing and the neighbourhood is very quiet and safe so you can get a very good rest. During the day the hotel offers only the pool and a some small areas to have a sun bath. The hotel is nice and has some pretty details. One of the thing that the hotel should improve is the breakfast because it is too basic (some juices, coffee, ham, cheese, bread, butter and depending on the day, eggs or omelette or crepes). We stayed at room no. 20 thay had a beautiful balcony and an extraordinary bed.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Glamour in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Jerkal
Reviews.Content: We spent like 1 hour looking for a place to stay in Playa del Carmen. There is a lot of places, with different rates as well. We checked two other hotels and finally we got to Casa Tikul. Somebody recommend me the place. We planned to stay for one night so we decided to search for boutique hotel or something like that. We walked till the most quiet part of the 5th avenue but still near of restaurants, beach clubs and bars. The service was very good, the hotel looks very new. The room was very clean with all things you need to have a good stay. The breakfast was a spotlight, we didn't know it was included in the room but that roof terrace and that lovely food made me remember a key in life "All We Need is LOVE"....

Reviews.Title: “Part of a welcome trend in Playa hotels”
Reviews.Author: MisterEtraveller
Reviews.Content: I've been travelling to Playa del Carmen since long before the area was marketed as the 'Mayan Riviera'. Casa Ticul seems to be part of a new trend towards smaller, comfortable, value oriented hotels that are almost anti-all-inclusive resort. If you're looking for a cruise ship on the beach than hotels like Casa Ticul are not for you. On the other hand, the king-size beds feature comfortable mattresses and quality bedding. The tile work and plumbing in the rooms are well above average and the envy of most average Canadian homes. The LCD flat-panel televisions are perfect for the rooms and have A/V inputs so you can hook up your own entertainment if the satellite offerings fall short. The breakfast on the terrace is not to be missed and should you stay at this hotel you should leave yourself open to trying the omelette of the day rather than just ordering the ham and cheese variety; the staff work at offering something unique on the menu for every serving. Hotel Casa Ticul is at the forefront of a new trend in Playa that strives to offer European standard comfort and service. It's the kind of Hotel that makes me want to come back to Playa del Carmen year after year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel, perfect Service”
Reviews.Author: Michi_J
Reviews.Content: I can highly recommend this small boutique hotel just off the busy part of Ave. 5. and very quiet. The beach is just over the street and within 5-10 minutes by foot you're in the bar & restaurant area. It is very stylish, yet affordable with a small pool and a beautiful roof-deck, perfect for breakfast or drinks. The staff is very helpful and really friendly. I arrived 1 day prior and it was no problem at all. Next time in Playa, I'd probably go there again

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: df20100607
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, close enough to restaurants and nightlife, but at an acceptable distance from crowds and noise. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again if I returned to Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel: location, charm and amenity”
Reviews.Author: Jubelea
Reviews.Content: Perfect location far enough away from the hullaballoo but close enough to walk there. Great staff and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sedonico
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 3 day stay at Casa Ticul. I was very happy with my stay there. They currently have a 40% discount promotion, so we paid 88 USD a night including tax. The rooms are very comfortable. The beds are wonderful, there is reliable wireless internet, the shower has plenty of water pressure and hot water, and the bathrobes and slippers were a nice touch too. The pool area is also very nice. I thought it was great that there were bathrooms by the pool as well, plus a shower to rinse off from the beach. The hotel has a roof terrace. The breakfast is served there in the morning, and at night, it's a nice place to look at the stars. I even saw a shooting star from the terrace. However, the roof terrace is up 3 flights of stairs, so if you have a problem with stairs it might be difficult for you to get to the breakfast. The hotel is located about a five minute walk from the beach. They provide complimentary passes to use chairs at Mamitas Beach Club and another club. We used the passes for Mamitas. The passes also include a 10% discount on the food at Mamitas, but be aware that they require that you show the pass before they bring your bill, or you won't get the discount. The hotel is about a 15 or 20 minute walk to the center of Playa nightlife on 12th Street. One thing that keeps me from giving this hotel 5 stars is that there is very little light in the hotel rooms. I understand that they are probably trying to create a relaxing or maybe romantic mood, but I'd like to have the option of regular lighting too. It was just too dark. Fortunately, the bathroom area has enough light to get ready by. I also would have liked to see more variety with the breakfast. Overall, I really enjoyed my experience at Casa Ticul and would definitely consider staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Too Awesome”
Reviews.Author: lapetiteabeille
Reviews.Content: ...if that we're possible. It was a last minute decision to stay in Playa for a night before heading down to Alkumal for a week. So I picked a left off hwy 307 and that happened to be 39th. On our way toward the beach, Heather said to me, "It would be great to find a hotel like The Standard in Hollywood." If you've ever been to The Standard you'll know what I mean when I say Casa Ticul is just too cool. Wonderful rooms, nice lighting and art pieces, a great little pool area to chill out at, the nicest staff. No human aquarium behind the reception, but is that really necessary? :) For what, ~80USD... shut the front door. Speaking of cool, check out Kool Fish next door to hang with the locals. We ended up part of a birthday party for the most wonderful 50 year old woman with the best skin I've ever met. Loved it so much we stayed another night on the way out of country. ~lil'bee

Reviews.Title: “Awesome boutique hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: mickren
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and were blown away by the service and quality, especially when you consider the price. The rooms were spacious and spotless, breakfast was good and the staff were excellent. We're backpackers who decided to splurge for a night and I'm happy to say it was an amazing experience. 500 meters to the beach and a 10 minute walk to the heart of the eating district. Do yourself a favor and stay here! We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: princess14Toronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Ticul June/July of 2010. I had read about it on the internet and booked it. Our stay was a pleasure there. The rooms are always clean with fresh beach and bath towels and clean in general. The staff are very personable and very friendly any questions you may have about Playa Del Carmen in general or around the cancun area, they are always so pleased to help. The continental breakfast in the morning is superb with a variety of coffees, juices, cereals, and one hot meal. Casa Ticul's location is great, its only a couple of blocks away from the 5th Avenue (the main strip) and only a couple of blocks from the beach. I would definateley go back again. Thank You, Gracias.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it the first time - had to go back.....”
Reviews.Author: scf1972
Reviews.Content: Once again...it was GREAT to be greeted by the nicest staff!!!! The rooms are so clean and those beds are just heavenly comfortable!!!! The location is wonderful - away from all the shops/rest but just a few minutes from it all. Once we got back to the hotel in the night from a long day enjoying the sun at Mamitas Beach Club and shopping......it was just so quiet and had perfect nights sleep!!!! There is a "bodega" like store on corner - great for snacks and water for the day-and so cheap. The breakfast was great and so tasty. We Love Casa Ticul!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service of any hotel, ever!”
Reviews.Author: SFLari
Reviews.Content: Here it is: the one hotel that truly cares about the comfort and happiness of its guests. First read the "cons" then see why the "pros" far outweigh them! CONS: *soundproofing not so hot. could hear people walking by in the courtyard even with the door and window closed. *loud fan. didn't bother me, but my fiance said it sounded like a helicopter taking off. *small pool in shade most of day. *two blocks away from the bustle of 5th street (this can also be labeled a "pro," actually) PROS: *good price (under $100US per night) *clean, modern room with comfortable bed *great toiletries including after-sun lotion and bug repellent--beat that! (though the bug repellent wasn't necessary, it was a great 'just-in-case' plus) *fabulous shower, comfy bathrobes and cool, tile flooring throughout. *delicious complimentary breakfast served on the rooftop each morning. features: fresh orange juice, sliced fruits and an authentic Mexican dish of the day (we had tamales). For the late-risers, breakfast is served until 10:30am (not bad!) *beach is two short blocks away. GORGEOUS beach. your stay includes free access to Mamitas beach club. This gives you free use of lounge chairs and umbrella on the sand plus 10% off (pricey) drinks. NOTE: Mamitas' customer service was HORRID. But this is not a reflection on Casa Ticul's great staff. *fab outdoor shower (clean sand off before heading back to your room) *flexible check-out. This was the one thing that cemented our love for this place. The staff was so incredibly flexible and laid back. We only booked one night but instead of chasing us out at 11am like any other hotel, they invited us to leave our things in the room and spend another day on the beach. They even gave us additional passes to the beach club. When we returned around 3:30pm, they graciously allowed us to freshen up before returning our key and departing. It felt as if we were staying with friends. Oh, and they recommended the most delicious hole-in-the-wall taco joint. mmm. In sum, though the hotel is not in the middle of all the 5th street action, this is where we'll always return. (NOTE: the area is under development and looks like plenty of high-end stores/hotels/spas will be moving in shortly).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at Casa Ticul”
Reviews.Author: indie_dive
Reviews.Content: We were happy with friendly service from Casa Ticul hotel staff. The hotel itself was small yet convenient for a week stay. It has small swimming pool, but we did not use it very often since we'd prefer to go to the beach and did some diving trips. The hotel also give you coupons that can be used to enter a beach club nearby to the hotel. It has wi-fi in the room as well. My favorite part is Casa Ticul's breakfast at roof terras, everyday the hotel serves different type of Mexican/Latin-Central American food - it's a good way to know some of local food for breakfast (btw, I really like Casa Ticul's Tamales). Location of Casa Ticul is quite a distance to the crowd of fifth avenue - which is that it is quite during the weekend. If you don't mind to walk a bit (which could be good exercise during your holiday ;)) to the center of fiifth avenue and would love to stay in small cozy hotel with friendly staff, then Casa Ticul is right choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise - Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: jxe47
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Playa Del Carmen for a family wedding in May, which was held at a large all-inclusive resort. We went a few days early and the wedding resort had no rooms for the first few days we were in Mexico, so we decided to try Casa Ticul. My husband was hesitant as we travel to this area quite frequently and have always stayed at large all-inclusive resorts. From the moment we checked in, we had no regrets! Our room was lovely, most comfortable bed we have ever had on vacation, everything in the room was high quality. The rooftop breakfast was delicious. Staff were above and beyond courteous and always willing to help, not like some of the other resorts when you would wait forever or try to find someone who spoke english. Sitting areas throughout the resort were lovely. Pool area fantastic! Restaurants within walking distance. We ate at a fish restaurant (Kool Fish) right next door that was fabulous and a pizza restaurant across the street just as good (great sangria and pizza). Lots of little markets in the same block for snacks, etc. Shopping district of Playa Del Carmen within walking distance. If we weren't afraid that we would upset family members we would have opted to stay at Casa Ticul and cancel the wedding resort reservations we had. We used ground transportation that the hotel arranged for us and I will tell you it was the BEST; we have tried various companies before and have had a few glitches, not this one, we were at the hotel in record time after arriving at the airport. We have a few recommendations to the resort: Some kind of table/chair and lamp in the guest rooms so you can sit and read especially if your travelling companion is still sleeping. An omelete or egg of the day along with the special at breakfast when it is crepes or something that not all people eat (this is my husband's suggestion, I was quite happy with everything that was served). I have been raving about this hotel to everyone back home. This will be our hotel of choice when traveling to this area of Mexico. WE LOVED IT.

Reviews.Title: “We've been there twice, we'd stay there again - it's the BEST”
Reviews.Author: AmberMWashbun
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Playa del Carmen as well as our second stay at Casa Ticul. We felt that whenever we were exhausted from seeing the sights and walking down 5th, we always had a place to go and relax (in the A/C). The receptionists are so helpful and polite. I speak very little Spanish, but they were always nice about trying to bridge the communication gap. There are some great restaurants within a couple of blocks of the hotel. We've started to prefer staying right in that area instead of going down to the busier areas. The hotel gives you free coupons for Mamita's beach club, which is just a few blocks away. Oh, did I mention the breakfast? Each morning featured a great special. To name a few, omelettes, quesadillas, blackberry crepes, and tamales. This was accompanied by fresh juices, fruits, and toast! They even make espresso and capuccinos! I've never had a free breakfast like this at any American hotel. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Cute and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: UneekRedhead
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from staying here for 5 nights. It was a change of pace for us, because we usually stay at all-inclusive hotels. We love Playa del Carmen, so we decided to look for a smaller place in town, and stumbled on Casa Ticul. Everyone was super helpful and courteous. The rooms were great, the pool is small but perfect for a swim. The beach is only a short walk away (about 2 blocks), just remember to get a coupon from the front desk, for a discount on the beach chairs. I really enjoyed the hotel. We got recommendations on where to eat from the front desk as well...

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluecarrot
Reviews.Content: Hotel Casa Ticul is a very pleasant but small hotel at the very north end of the developed part of 5th Ave. It is NOT one of the big resorts or all inclusive sort of places that seem to dominate Playa del Carmen. That was exactly what I liked about it!! Ticul is out of the frenetic tourist area just enough to be relatively quiet while still being nearby and close enough to walk to everything! The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful and the hotel decor and styling was very tasteful and modern. The beach club is one of the better ones and several friends who live in PDC actually frequent it because of this!! The A/C worked great, the bed was super comfy, the hotel was just great all around!! The only complaints that we had were these: the water from the sink/shower is not filtered (so dont drink it!!!) and the first night our friend complained of noise from the courtyard of the hotel. The next morning the staff quickly switched him to a different room and he had no more noise trouble. I will definitely stay here next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Hotel but a bit Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Kristeeleigh
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at Hotel Ticul for a 7 night in May in room number 4 on the first floor. The hotel was a small boutique hotel on the not so busy side of 5th Ave. Out room was small but comfortable and had enough room for just the two of us. It was very humid so the de-humidifiers that were provided came in great help in keeping the room from becoming too humid. The beds were comfortable but we really didnt care for the pillows (personal preference). The room had a ceiling fan but it only was set on one speed of super fast which was good at night but sort of strong for going all day, they should find a way to change the speeds. The bathroom was nice with large shower , but the faucet on the vessel sink was way too long for the sink and got in the way when trying to wash your face or etc., this made water get all over the floor. They provided bathrobes and slippers which were a nice touch. The cleanliness of the room was very good and the housekeeping did a great job. We did have a few small ants in the shower that were attacking my razor, maybe they were attracted to the built in shaving bar on it which contains shea butter, but we never saw them again once I removed the razor from the shower. Also one night we saw a huge roach crawl under our door but then quickly he ran back out and down the hall when we looked out the door to make sure he was gone away from our room. Also there were mosquitoes in our room , we believe they came in from when the house keeping would open the windows during their cleaning. The only major thing we found to bother us about this hotel was the noise. I don't know if it was our room location or just the very thin walls and gaps above and below the door but you could hear everything. Doors would begin slamming at about 8am every morning and we could hear the housekeeping cleaning the rooms next to us. We had the dehumidifier , fan and AC on so it would block out some of the noise but it really didn't help. We had breakfast one morning on the roof top and it was good but only got to make it up there one morning, but would recommend it if you have time to make it up there. The location was good, about a 15 min walk to the action part of 5th, which we didn't mind walking to every night for dinner and drinks. We never felt unsafe or like the hotel was too far out. The beach was only about a 5 min walk down and was great. We did get the passes to the beach club on a Sunday but when we got there it was crazy packed so we just walked down the beach and found a spot to lay out at. Over all this was a great little hotel with very small problems but I would recommend it for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST in Playa”
Reviews.Author: draghignazzo
Reviews.Content: The staff was superb, great amenities, confortable rooms, fair price.. Casa Ticul thruly deserves the best rate!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to start each day of our vacation”
Reviews.Author: KatoJen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Casa Ticul from May 2-10th 2010. A representative met us outside the airport in Cancun and drove us directly to the hotel. We were so glad we prearranged the airport transfers as it is a bit chaotic outside the airport. The transfers were also less expensive and more comfortable than a taxi each way. Once we arrived at the hotel we found our room was very clean and had everything we needed including complimentary bath products which smelled delightful and wi-fi access. We found the beds to be very comfortable and every morning really enjoyed breakfast on the rooftop including toast, fresh fruit, ham & cheese, fresh juices, coffee, cappuccinos and daily yummy breakfast specials! After breakfast we would take a short walk to the beach and go to Mamitas beach club with coupons from the hotel for free beach chair rentals & a discount for the restaurant. We recommend getting to the beach by 11:00am or you run the risk of no umbrellas being available - these cost us 30 peso to rent and are definitely worth it! After spending the day in the hot sun the hotel room with its air conditioning and ceiling fan was a very comfortable cool escape from the heat outside. All the staff at the hotel were very friendly and the guys at the front desk were always able to give advice or information when we asked. We went on an excursion to Xel-Ha and Tulum that the hotel staff recommended and arranged which we really enjoyed. The hotel is located at the far end of 5th Avenue so there was a bit of a walk to get to the lively part of Playa Del Carmen, but really it was a good thing because we could escape the noise of downtown and retire to our quite, cool, room at the end of the day! We enjoyed everything about our stay at Hotel Casa Ticul and would definitely recommend staying here to friends. One strange thing - a few days before our last we asked for a late checkout for our last day and the front desk guy said it would not be a problem as our room had not booked. The next day we wanted to confirm our room still had not booked and there was a different guy at the front desk. He said it would be fine but subject to a $30 fee. We thought that was kinda strange cause the first guy never mentioned that part. We said that was okay as we didn't really have anywhere else to go before our shuttle to the airport. On the day we checked out the original guy was at the front desk and he said there would not be a charge for the late checkout! The only complaints we had were we had to pay cash for the excursion arranged by the hotel as they could not accept credit cards for that. But we found a bank machine on 5th Avenue so it really wasn't that big of a deal. Also, a couple of times we were woken up by loud guests in the hallway - I guess the room doors are a little light weight and the sound goes through. We were staying on the third floor and a few mornings it sounded like ponies were walking on the roof - staff getting ready for breakfast perhaps moving furniture? Not really a big deal either. At the end of the day, the positives really outnumber the very negatives about our stay at the Hotel Casa Ticul.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be definitely coming back again!!”
Reviews.Author: artistbaron
Reviews.Content: Prior to arriving, I was in a lot of communication with the hotel because I was flying in late and a friend of mine was flying in two days before me but the reservations were in my name. The staff was always prompt at responding to my e-mails and exceptionally helpful. Everything was straightened out before I arrived and things ran smoothly.
