They offer a service that picks you up from the airport and takes you to the Hotel which is always a plus for me when flying into another country. What made this place great was it's location, comfort, and style. I'm a fan of the smaller boutique hotels compared to the resorts. And this place was definitely my style. The room was a great size, the bed was enormous, and my friend and I felt very comfortable there. The hotel is located only a short 5 minute walk from all of the restaurants, stores, beach, and action, but far enough to still be quiet. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to love it”
Reviews.Author: NikkiG1133
Reviews.Content: Stayed in May at Hotel Casa Ticul. I really wanted to love it here and I will start with all of the positives because there are a lot of them: Liked the room, fell in love with the shower even though a lot of water ended up making it on the bathroom floor, nice amenities, they provide beach towels and passes to the beach club, air conditioner worked great, and very comfortable big bed. Sorry, we don't remember his name, but really appreciated the young gentleman with the mustache at the front desk- very kind, offered some nice suggestions, and always asked about our day. Breakfast was also pretty good and a nice bonus. On the negative side, I wish there was more storage in the room- we basically had to live out of our suitcases for a week. Our room also seemed to be last in-line for cleaning each day so it was usually after 3pm before it was cleaned - kind of cut into the afternoon nap plans. I guess the major issue was with the noise we encountered. Our room was the junior suite and the doors leading out to the balcony didn't seem to seal completely - there was at least a 1/2" gap on each side. One thing I was scared about was bugs entering the room through this gap but that was never a problem --- the big issue became the noise level that filtered into the room. This seems to be a very busy street - especially in the morning (when it would have been nice to sleep-in while on vacation). Between the garbage truck and the loud motorcycles or scooters it was just like being at home since we live on a very busy street and really I want to forget about home while on vacation. Maybe if the balcony doors sealed correctly this noise issue could be eliminated or reduced. On our last night in the room there also was a mystery sound that was like listening to a clothes dryer with shoes in it (not pleasant). We walked outside and did not hear the sound but it was loud and clear inside our room. No idea where this was coming from! The sad part is that I really researched our choices on where to stay in Playa and so many of the other places mentioned noise issues and since noise was never mentioned in any of the other reviews I read Casa Ticul was our choice. Maybe Playa is just a loud loud place........... All and all I would recommend the hotel to a friend but with some warnings.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: jmartinez150
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised to see mixed reviews about this place...I had an amazing stay. Playa del Carmen is gorgeous and this place is like being right at home, everything is very genuine and pleasant. This boutique hotel has only about 19 rooms, a small pool and a rooftop terrace...the decor is very modern and refined. The rooms have great A/C, flat panel TV's, rain shower heads and great light. They serve a very modest free breakfast at the rooftop terrace and have daily specials like breakfast burritos, omelettes and apple crepes, they also make great lattes. The hotel is at the end of 5th Avenue (main strip) and it's a perfect location, close to the beach (they give you passes to Playa Mamitas for chairs and umbrellas), and the rooms all have wi-fi. I cannot imagine staying anywhere else, I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “My partner wanted to go back home when he saw the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peritoluvsme
Reviews.Content: To be fair, we had just spent three days at the Weston Resort in Cancun which is right on the Caribbean. I thought I understood that the Casa was on the beach. When we finally found it and pulled up in front, my partner wanted me to change the reservation. I thought I had 24 hours to change it, so I asked if we could delete the last day. They had charged my credit card as soon as we walked in the door, or possibly before that, and would not let us out of the reservation. The person the receptionist called said I had made the reservation 4 months previous. Not so. I made it two days before we left for Cancun. We got our ticket for the beach since we could not check in right away. It poured down rain as we walked to the beach. We never did find the place they told us to go to. Our room was right on the court where people smoke and socialize. There is a very small pool there. The rooftop breakfast was very nice even though the wind was blowing everything about. The three block walk to the shopping area was safe, but I would not try it late at night. I stay in hostels when I travel to Europe alone, and thought of this as an upscale hostel. My partner hated this place. The staff is very pleasant and not their fault it is not on the beach and there is not a jaquzi in the room. The only bad thing were the bites on my legs which I recognized as bedbugs dining on me as I slept. These ubiqutous creatures are a fact of life, especially in Mexico. But extra care in cleaning can rid a room of them. I read all the other reviews and agree this is a good place to stay since many ruins and theme parks are close by.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review...”
Reviews.Author: joa51
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about the hotel... It was certainly not what I expected. The positive: Clean hotel ground and friendly staff. I agree with all other reviews that every staff working at this hotel is very helpful!I The breakfast on the rooftop was nice and the kitchen staff was very attentive. The neutral: Location -- If you are planning to use public transportation to get around, please note it will be a bit of a walk to the bus station. The shops and restaraunts are at a shorter distance but I would have prefered it to be a little closer. The negative: While the room was always left clean by the cleaning staff, it was just way too moist and muggy, even with the A/C on. The bed was a bit too soft (preference issue) and the water pressure in the shower and the toilet was inconsistent. Perhaps it was just the room we were in but I found these things a bit uncomfortable. If I may recommend a couple things to the hotel owner...1) Consider bicycle rental for guests. It sure would be helpful in accessing the bus terminal and the main drag down 5th avenue. 2) Better in-room climate control. Maybe the A/C can be adjusted by the hotel staff before the guest arrives so the room does not feel so humid. No other reviews seemed to point this out as an issue so it may have just been our room... I personally wouldn't recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: ChrisSydneyAus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Casa Ticul at the end up April and found it a great place to relax and enjoy what Playa Del Carmen had to offer. The room was very spacious and comfortable, the hotel was always spotless and has everything you need, and the staff were always incredibly helpful! I would recommend Casa Ticul to anyone who is looking for a great place to stay and relax in Playa, with it being only a short walk to great restaurants and the beach. I wouldn't hesitate to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in a rough”
Reviews.Author: MarcTessier
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hotel Casa Ticul was just over a week. I found the staff always extremely friendly, specifically Wenseslao (the hotel clerk), who was always informative, and professional with every intension to make our stay with them a memorable one. The rooms were kept meticulously clean. The breakfast was amazingly good (specifically the cheese crepes and mushroom omelette were out of this world) a great start to your day. The hotel is two minute walk to the beach and maybe five to where shopping market place on 5th street starts. All over i had great experience and stay, and would recommend this hotel to any friend or family member.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like being home”
Reviews.Author: JulieTMinneapolis_MN
Reviews.Content: This is the first time my boyfriend and I have been to Mexico. The hotel staff made our stay pleasantly welcoming and we left with a very good impression of Mexico. The beach is within walking distance and the free pass to use their chairs at Mamitas beach club was awesome. If you are not a walker, there are lots of cabs available. But if you take the public transportation a lot, it is a 15-20 min. walk to the bus station. We love being away from the crowd on 5th Ave though. Thank you for your hospitality Casa Ticul!!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Ticul, Great Value, Great Hotel, Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Chicagoan1962
Reviews.Content: Hotel Casa Ticul exceeded our expectations. Very clean, very nice rooms. We stayed in a King room which met our needs very nicely. The room was comfortable and fairly roomy. Housekeeping did a great job and the hotel is very well maintained and clean. We loved th decor. The staff were excellent - from the two young men who worked the desk to those who prepared out breakfast each morning. The guys at the desk were more than helpful and informative about the area and always welcomed you back with a smile. If you are looking for a party hotel this is not it. If you are looking to lay out by the pool then find a big resort. Hotel Casa Ticul is a small hotel with a lot of class and has a very personalized "family" type feel. The Hotel is a short walk to the beach. Although it is not in the main area of town - it took us about 15 minutes to walk from 38 street to the bus station near 2nd street. The walk was good exercise to work off those meals - and the taxi is only $5.00 if you don't want to walk. The area Casa is in is quiet and there are a few good places to eat in the immediate area. We found that exploring out to 30th Avenue is where a lot of the more authentic food is, and often just a short walk and we found it to be safe. If I ever come back to Play del Carmen - Hotel Casa Ticul will be the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay.. away from the crowd”
Reviews.Author: Manny17
Reviews.Content: We had an exellent stay.. we had arranged the transfer pickup via the Hotel, but our flight had a delay of almost 6 hours.. One call to the reception and everything would be arranged. So it was our driver was still waiting for us at the airport and brought us to the Hotel... It was raining and the guy from the reception waited for us outside with an umbrella. Our orinigal room had some waterdamage, so we received the Honeymoonsuite instead.. It was a warm welcome after hours delay... The next day, it was still raining and our suitcases were brought to another nice room.. The beds are the best!!!!! very large and comfortable. The breakfast at the open air rooftop is simple, but good and very friendly staff.. and real fresh squeezed orangejuice... The Hotel is situated about 15min walk from the bus station, away from the large (noisy) crowd and close to what is said to be the italian influenced district.. nice restaurants and shops nearby. We went to the beach, which is just a short walk, the receptionist recommended us the Canibal Royal, a beach lounge with free sunbeds and gave us a 10% discount voucher.. It was great, the bar had a fantasctic art deco design, the staff was friendly and fast, and the food was very delicious at lunch.. we stayed all day. Just a little walk downtown 5th avenue is avery nice italian restaurant with fresh homemade pasta's, I don't know the name, but you will recognize it in the evening as the cook is preparing the pasta's near the street. Just nearby, nice loungebars, shops and not much husseling from shop-owners to buy stuff from the shop like you have more to the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for honeymooners!!”
Reviews.Author: MaruDuran
Reviews.Content: I never leave feedbacks but my experience at this hotel was so great that I would like to compliment it and recommend it to everyone who is planning to visit Playa del Carmen. I don't know where to start... the service was amazing, everybody was very friendly, they seemed happy to be working! The guys at the lobby helped us with everything they could, and the girls who served breakfast where really sweet and made delicious omelettes!! (they have a "special" omelette every day, GREAT BREAKFAST!) What impressed me the most of the hotel was its design which is very minimal and classy.. the rooms are huge, and the bed is so comfortable it was hard to come back to my bed at home! Its also really good that they don't accept kids in the hotel, it helps to keep the calm and relaxed atmosphere. I could keep complimenting this hotel but I want to go to sleep... seriously, you won't regret going to this hotel! PS: Wenseslao, si lees esto te queriamos saludar y agradecerte por todo. Somos Maru y Sebastian, la pareja de Uruguay (espero nos recuerdes jeje)... te portaste 10 puntos con nosotros! Cuidate mucho y segui disfrutando playa del carmen, nosotros ya extranamos muchooo

Reviews.Title: “Soooo Nice”
Reviews.Author: beezinez
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our honeymoon. I was at first reluctant b/c it wasnt a large hotel. but i am sooo happy i decided to listen to my mom and pay much less to stay a small hotel like casa ticul. the breakfast in the morning on the roof amazing everyday. we thought it was going to be just a continental bkfast but its so much more. the rooms are nice, the bed is great, the only thing is that the walls are kinda thin so you hear when your neighbors come in and out. but its in a great location, the staff was always friendly and great. i loved it and plan to go back. definately....

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel with the most comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: sunlvr27
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is just out of the "downtown" area. We walked everywhere we went. I jogged every morning from the hotel down 5th Avenue and then the beach on the way back. It is located right on 5th, but it is quiet because it is a few blocks away from the shopping district. The room was great. Water pressure, hot water all the time, beautiful furnishings. VERY CLASSY! And the bed! I have never had a bed that huge. It seemed bigger than your average King size bed and was the most comfortable bed I have EVER had in my life!!!!! The only thing I didn't like was that I couldn't leave the windows open when we left or overnight because we were right off the courtyard and there were no screens and someone could just come in through the windows if they really wanted to. Not that they would, but I don't take too many chances like that. We loved it here and would highly recommend it. The breakfast on the top deck was great and the staff was super friendly and helpful. The beach was a couple blocks away and was so nice. We walked everywhere we went. I would recommend the Blue Lobster restaurant, fantastic food! Make sure to barter your prices when shopping. The bus station is just a 15-minute walk and will take you to Cancun for under $4. Thanks Hotel Casa Ticul for making our vacation a great one!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little place close to the beach but away from the hordes”
Reviews.Author: hdparker
Reviews.Content: I really loved this place - only about 20 rooms, lovely little pool and rooftop area for breakfas. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. Great restaurants nearby too and a nice stroll down to the action along Avenida Quinta when you feel like checking it out. Would definitely recommend and return.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: Giny123
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 4 nights in Playa del Carmen as our last stop on the Yucatan roundtrip and really liked the small hotel. The beach is very close, the shopping / restaurant street starts after few minutes walking, to the center it is about 10 minutes. But so it is very quiet at the night, many hotels in Playa del Carmen are too close to the noisy street with all the pubs, clubs, restaurant with music all night long. It is a nice atmosphere there, sitting on the roof terrace for breakfast feels a little bit like at home. The breakfast is good, especially the speciality of the day, mexican style breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, away from the crowds, but close to good food and the beach”
Reviews.Author: DockOscar
Reviews.Content: Casa Ticul is a good place to come if you do not want to be in the middle of the Playa bar scene, especially at night. There are good restaurants nearby and it's right down the street from a beach entrance. The breakfast was stellar and the staff were really helpful. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but Love for Casa Ticul”
Reviews.Author: Marie F
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends visiting Playa del Carmen. The small, intimate property was like a home away from home. It's located north on 5th Avenue, away from all the noise of downtown. But, don't think that it's far from all the action! There was a great cafe and several choices of restaurants nearby. It was a couple of blocks from the beach clubs (Mamitas or Cannibal Royal) and we liked being able to choose daily vouchers to visit either. The breakfast was great every day, and the staff was really friendly... so I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “quite good for this money. reception and breakfast are perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Irina_Russia_Moscow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite good for this money, design is elegant, location is suitable, a litle bit far from pedestrian area. Breakfast is very good. The only problem I can mention is very noisy cafe or restaurant across the street. Reception is perfect and very helpful! Special thanks for Alisa!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, comfortable stay for two nights.”
Reviews.Author: tonynesta
Reviews.Content: The Casa Ticul a small, quaint hotel that has a very hospitable feel to it. It makes me feel that I am in someone’s three-story house-villa with lots of comforts and conveniences. It has classy impressive modern art-deco look to it. The casa has a small pool and patio with chairs and a massage table on the ground floor with the hotel’s rooms surrounding it. There are also some hotel rooms on the second floor. There’s a three story staircase that leads up to the rooftop terrace where there are lounge chairs and sun umbrellas all around. Here is where a full complimentary satisfying breakfast is served in the mornings. The location of the hotel is good. It’s in a quiet neighborhood and not too close to Playa Del Carmen’s touristy fifth avenue which is only a five minute walk away. The beach is also about a five to ten minute walk. The rooms are on the small side but are comfortable, clean, air conditioned and quiet. There’s a large walk-in shower. The king size bed is okay but it seems to take up the whole room. What I DID NOT LIKE was the futon mattress on the bed. It was too soft and mushy since I prefer a firm regular mattress instead of the soft futon. Also, the room could use a few chairs to sit on with a small table but there are plenty of tables and chairs on the multilevel patios outside. The free WiFi internet signal is really fast and reliable in the room. There's a mini size fridge in the room. There’s only street parking but that’s easy to find in this safe and quiet neighborhood. There’s also a few great restaurants just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Radiating with warmth - Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kim_mclawhorn
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Playa for the first time and chose Casa Ticul based on the reviews and value. The hotel was beautiful, the rooms and bed very comfortable, and the staff were so helpful and attentive. Although the hotel is not right on the beach, Mamitas and Cannible Royal Beach Clubs are an easy walk a couple of blocks away. As a solo traveler on this trip, I felt perfectly safe and well taken care of while I was there. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mermaid83
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Hotel Casa Ticul. From the moment we walked in we were greeted by name, and were always "welcomed home" by the front desk staff who were available 24 hours. The hotel was in a quiet part of town however in a very convenient location (5 minute walk) to the beach, 5th Avenue shops, and TONS of restaurants. The breakfast on the roof top each morning was delicious and prepared to order. We would most certainly stay here again and recommend this place to other couples!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Brose10
Reviews.Content: The owners and staff............everyone of them made sure we where having a good time and that everything was to our satisfaction 24/7. After a couple of days there the hotel felt like our home, a great place to comeback to after a long day of fun and sun. When it was time to leave my wife and I felt like we where saying goodbye to our family. Cannot wait to go back! Ambrose and Theresa Chicago Il. USA

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, would not hesitate to stay agian”
Reviews.Author: DanWashingtonState
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel and feels like it. Serice was excellent. It is usually very quiet, partly because it is past the noise of "5th". We liked that and did not mind the walk to the main shopping district. Rooms not overly large, but big enough and beds comfortable. We would like to see a rack outside to dry dive gear, but the hotel does have limited space so we understand why they don't.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location in Playa del Carmen.”
Reviews.Author: MichiganElizabeth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at this hotel because it was close to the beach, restaurants, etc. in Playa del Carmen, but away so it was not right in the middle of all the action. All the staff were great and recommended some great places to eat--must try the Origenes. The breakfast on the rooftop was great--had different omelets every day.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: tacotacotaco
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel for those who want to be close enough to all the action (20 minute walk to the end of 5th Avenue) but still able to get a quiet night's rest. The service was excellent, the rooms clean and modern. We especially loved the breakfast on the rooftop every morning- simple omelettes and quesadillas, but the service was absolutely spectacular and we LOVED the salsa that they gave us specially! :) This hotel was an excellent value for the cost and we would not hesitate to recommend this plance to others and to return again int eh future!

Reviews.Title: “Best. Customer service. Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Travelonmydime
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over new years holiday and I was blown away by the customer service. everyone on the staff, from front desk, to chef to cleaning staff treated us like we were guests at their home rather than just in a hotel, but there was so much more to comment on. In brief: Food: They provide a full breakfast that's fresh and not once did they repeat the entree. Room: Clean, and special mention of the bed, which was super comfortable (not hard). with wonderful linens. The toiletries (soaps, etc) were all premium quality--like they provide in the luxury hotels in the US. Location: A short walk to the beach, and in a nice, quiet area of 5th Ave. There is a convenience store (with liquor, wine, beer and other necessities next door) as well as a very nice Mexican restaurant that we ate at frequently. Oh, and the high speed internet was flawless. I would stay there again and highly recommend them to others. Cons: I cannot think of any. Ok, if you twist my arm--the pool is small and not meant for swimming laps.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: bonaDumela
Reviews.Content: The hotel is away from all the noise of 5th avenue but close enough to be part of it. It is walking distance from the beach as well. The service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was wonderful along with the staff .”
Reviews.Author: SABRINAChicago
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel cute .... location was perfect for us ..... walking distance to everything we need ....can not say enough about the staff ....... Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: d-worldhopper
Reviews.Content: Just like other tripadvisor users say, this is the best kept secret in hotels in Playa del Carmen. I did a lot of shopping and research before I booked this one, and later found out that I've made the best choice possible. It's an intimate boutique style hotel, that really feels more like B&B. The location is great, it's about two small blocks away from all of the excitement of 5th avenue, yet you don't have to worry about all of the noise at night, and I (young female) had no trouble walking back home at night even by myself. Can't say enough good things about service and people who work at the hotel. Everyone was super friendly and welcoming. Especially loved breakfasts on the roof: fresh fruit, freshly squeezed juices, expresso, and cooked to order omelets, crapes, and again all of this with incredibly friendly service and awesome atmosphere - a perfect way to start your day. Rooms were very comfortable as well. Nice size, modern decor, great shower (one of those rain-showers with high pressure), nice closet system (a lot of shelves), even a small fridge. Very clean. Every day we'd come back from the beach and find the room nicely cleaned up and refreshed. (The only couple of things you might want to prepare for : TV only has couple of English speaking channels with mostly old movies, but you can watch movies on Internet, or bring some with you. And bathroom door is glass - but it's matted glass, you can't really see through it.) Most importantly, they had free wireless internet and plenty of free street parking around. The beach is about 2.5 blocks down - an easy walk, and hotel gives you plenty of towels and passes to get lounge chairs, etc. There are tons of good restaurants around as well. Monkey Bar - about a 100 ft away - had great shrimp tacos and many other fairly inexpensive choices. The Uruguayan steak house (around the corner) was lovely as well (the deep they bring with bread is to die for), Piscaderia - left and left around the block - had great seviche, but no service in English. And my personal favorite - Molusko - just a couple of blocks down the 5th avenue on the right - had a great spanish twist on seafood - their tuna was unbelievable! There are several small markets right next door, so you can buy whatever you need there: water, sun-block, snacks. One more thing, this hotel does accept Amex (my Amex was the only card that didn't have foreign transaction fees), and I found out from someone we've met at a local bar, that most of hotels in the area do not accept it. He checked out a lot of hotels, and was telling us that he ended up paying more than what we paid, and his hotel wasn't even that nice or clean. So that reassured that Casa Ticul really was a great deal. Without a question, if I'm ever back in the area, this is the hotel I would stay at and I highly recommend it to anybody. As a matter of fact, I'm looking for an excuse to get back there as soon as possible :-)

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable price for location, service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: terratrotter
Reviews.Content: This little boutique hotel is the best value in Playa del Carmen. Since we went there without knowing the location, we were pleasantly surprised the it was located right on 5th Avanue, minutes away from restaurants, shops and services. We were also glad that it was in a quieter end of the town - no loud playing music in the radius. It was also minutes away from the beach, however we did not like the Mamita's Beach as it was really crowded and had a DJ playing all day long! We used to drive to Tulum to spend a day on the beach in a quiet peaceful atmosphere, but it's up to you... We enjoyed our daily breakfast on the terrace, with a variety of crepes, eggs and omlets, fresh fruit and juices all made by the hostess herself! The owners were so sweet and hospitable - it felt like we came to visit our family. There is a lovely restaurant across the streed called Cocina 38, and whenever we were lazy to "go too far" we would come down and have the best meal.

Reviews.Title: “What a warm and friendly place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Anjulila
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for 3 nights and were off doing excursions to Xcaret and Xel-Ha during the daytime, but we have only positive things to say about this hotel. The front desk staff were exceptionally pleasant and helpful, whether it was finding a restaurant, deciding how best to travel somewhere or explaining aspects of Mexican culture. The room was nicely appointed. The air conditioner and dehumidifer were loud, but that is the nature of the beast! You can always turn them off. The king bed was comfortable. The extra touches like bathrobes, fragrant shampoo, and mosquito repellent were appreciated. Breakfast on the roof was delicious. (Me gusto!) The beach is only a 4 block walk away - the same distance as it would be in many "on beach" all-inclusives. The location is 3-4 blocks from the end of the 5th Ave. pedestrian walkway which can make it a bit far to walk to the bus or collectivo stations, but also means that it is quieter than closer hotels might be. It worked for us. You need to know the cross roads to be able to tell taxi drivers where to find the hotel since it is not yet well known. We did recommend the hotel to friends who had booked elsewhere, but were looking for something smaller and more intimate. You cannot beat the treatment we received from the staff and we would certainly consider returning if we are able to come back to Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: HeartofSedona
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Casa Ticul! The location was great... on Quinta Ave., the heart of Playa, but far away enough to be quiet & relaxing (which was important to us having been to Playa many, many times and really didn't want to be a part of the 2 am party crowd noise). Also, our accommodations were great... clean, modern & comfortable. The staff & owners were extremely friendly & helpful. They responded generously to our every need & the breakfasts were delicious!!!... which showed the exceptional care they take to please their clients. It was a wonderful discovery, finding a small, family-run boutique hotel where the 'satisfaction' of clients, owners & staff alike is the principal concern. We just loved the thoughts on the face of the building...'sleep and dream as one heart' This said it all for us!

Reviews.Title: “It was a pleasure to stay at Casa Ticul!”
Reviews.Author: shatziheart
Reviews.Content: Amazing place, great customer service. Highly recommended. Be aware if you get a corner room that is next to the stair case it gets really noisy early in the morning from people going up and down.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: worldytaveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed a full week at Casa Ticul. Very clean, confortable and all services are offered with a smile. This small boutique hotel is well located a few blocks north of the busy pedestrian section of 5 Avenida where it is very quiet and secure. Free passes are offered for Marmita's Beach club which is only a short distance away (10minutes walk). Excellent breakfast are personnaly served by the owners Martin and his charming wife.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, away from the action, nice staff, great big beds!”
Reviews.Author: snohobo
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were driving into Playa Del Carmen and found this hotel online. I was about to be sick from a bad taco so getting checked in swiftly was very important. Room was nice, clean, large bed, TV, and from what I can remember - had an impeccably clean toilet - I mean i was getting personal with that thing. I do hve to admit though - the hotel itself is somewhat noisy - not well insulated. And the pool pump was acting up while were there and making a loud claking noise - I'm sure it will be replaced or repaired but the time you go. If you are a light sleeper - bring some plugs. the breakfast was pretty good too - decent coffee, fruit, nutella, and an omelette bar of sorts. Would stay there again. If you want a fancy dinner - do not miss Cocina 38 (or 36?) across the way.

Reviews.Title: “less is more...”
Reviews.Author: galloycava
Reviews.Content: A hotel that does not claim, but "is". A calm place, tastefully, good service, without children!!! They made us feel like home, we really enjoyed our stay Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Casa Ticul is outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: mtexm
Reviews.Content: The staff is awesome, the value of the hotel is awesome, and the location is a few blocks from the louder part of Playa. My visit was awesome! Can you tell I enjoyed my stay..LOL!

Reviews.Title: “extraordinary service”
Reviews.Author: barsa
Reviews.Content: Casa Ticul is one of the best options in playa del Carmen, the hotel has an extraordinary ambiance, the staff is always looking for offer you a good service and the location is becoming the best in Playa del Carmen, a lot of good restaurants around it. I highly recommend Casa Ticul, the best value in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Ticul is a one of a kind experience in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: kathyhOrlando
Reviews.Content: Casa Ticul is a unique combination of a boutique hotel experience and a bed and breakfast. From the moment you walk in, the hotel staff knows your name, pours you a glass of wine, takes your luggage, checks on you during your stay, asks if you need directions, a dinner reservation or a taxi. They even deliver coffee to you in the morning. The rooftop restaurant is delightful and trendy, for breakfast or a romantic meal. The lobby is artsy, elegant, yet cozy. In all my extensive travels abroad, I have not encountered something so uspcale and so cozy all in one. Congratulations to the Casa Ticul team! Kathy Hernandez, Orlando, FL

Reviews.Title: “Like Home”
Reviews.Author: penn_state_dave
Reviews.Content: I had a great time in Playa and Casa Ticul was great. I first thing about Casa Tical you must realize is that it is on the new side of the town. 5th Ave is building out north and Casa Ticul is on the bleeding edge of that growth. So the building, rooms, beds, marble showers, etc are nice and new. The hotel is in a quiet and nice location, yet you are only a few minutes walk to the action. I felt very safe in all areas of Playa Del Carmen. We live in New York City, so I feel like I have a good gauge for judging safety, and I did not feel even the slightest bit threatened at any time. The people are generally very nice and outgoing. I feel like I even made some friends in town that I will keep touch with. The staff at Casa Ticul is great. They make you feel like family. My wife got a bit burned in the sun. Elisa must have noticed because she brought in a big piece of fresh aloe that she cut from her garden at home. I asked the front desk to set up a taxi to Tulum and they pointed out that renting a car is better and much cheaper. They were right, I am so happy I rented the car. It was easy and it let me explore so much more. Mauricio had the car delivered to the hotel and ready for me at 9am. They also were very helpful in setting up our excursions like the ATV trip we took. Any assistance you need, they are there. Unlike other portions of our trip to Mexico, Playa was a place where we were always out and about. There are so many great restaurants, bars, shops, and beaches. We really liked Di Vino, it is a bit pricey, but the food and wine were great. The foie gras was huge and amazing. Late night, the lounge by the pool at Deseo is a great place to get drinks, lye on a bed, relax, and socialize. We were not in our room much, but we always felt good coming back to Ticul to retire for evening. It honestly felt like going home. Because it was a quiet beach and restaurant filled week with my wife, Casa Ticul was perfect. If I was going to Playa with all my guy friends, I would have stayed at a trendier spot more central downtown. All in all, the place was great, the price was right, and I would definitely go

Reviews.Title: “My favorite small hotel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: RoccoMiami
Reviews.Content: Location+price+service+features= Casa Ticul I love this place. It really feels like home, small, quiet, clean, staff is sweet and helpfull. Jessica (Sales Director) is very cooperative and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent attention”
Reviews.Author: JRRMPuebla
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel during my last part of my trip to Playa del Carmen. When I called to the hotel in order to do my reservation the personnal had a excellent attention by phone. One month later I was in Playa del Carmen and I was surprised about the kind personal who is working in this hotel. The rooms are very confortable and the bed is amazing... really. The hotel is very quiet, it's small but I think it has all the necesary items to enjoy Playa del Carmen. Playa mamitas is very near of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: jenu1220
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is away from the busiest part of 5th Ave. The rooms are very nicely decorated, we enjoyed the breakfast each morning. Cave of the Monkey restaurant on 38th Ave. towards beach was wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Comfortable, Simply Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: perki115
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very beautiful and very clean. The bed was so comfortable, i slept amazing! The breakfast up on the gorgeous roof was a great way to start the day. The staff was so friendly, polite, and helpful. I have never recieved that great of service at a hotel. Staff helped me with anything from directions to handing me an umbrrella when it was raining. It was a great place to stay! :)

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price, staff very kind ahd helpful”
Reviews.Author: alexpar
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Casa Ticul for three nights. The hotel is a little bit far from Playa del Carmen night spots, which could be either good or bad depending on what you like. I didn't like the location because it was a long walk to restaurants and it was very hot, and also made us feel kinda of unsafe walking at night. The room was confi. No elevator, if you are lazy don't get a third floor room :). Staff was great, very helpful with everything. They are building a bar in the rooftop, right know they serve breakfast there for 3 bucks which is convenient I'm not sure if I would stay there again, I would do some more research first, I saw a lot of nice places closer to the beach and nightlife in Playa

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but located at outskirts of La Quinta, with noisy nighttime neighbors!”
Reviews.Author: nubux
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and friendly staff, clean rooms, super nice linen and comfortable beds. However, fans were either on/off rather than with dimmer. Location is quiet most of the time, but on Saturday night, the salon/day lounge in front of the hotel blasts its music into 2AM+. Could not sleep with windows & door closed. Asked Mgt to do something about it, and they said they would. The guy stepped out of the hotel, stood around and wandered back in without confronting the spa/day lounge club. When confronted, he made up some story about the police being called, about him talking to the club owner. I had been observing him the whole time and he did none of what he said he did. If your customer complains, then either address it and tell them how you address it, or tell them you cannot fix the problem. Don't tell them you are fixing the problem, but in reality, doing nothing about it. The music did not end until past 2AM, by which time, I fell asleep fitfully.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MSU09
Reviews.Content: A group of grad students and physicians traveled from Michigan to volunteer at a local clinic. I was a bit nervous about where we would end up staying. However, right when I walked in the door, I knew I was one lucky girl!! The hotel is adorable, small, friendly, and very clean. Our group was spread all over 5th, and my hotel room was one of the best. There is air that gets as cold as you want it, the beds are white down, the shower is all glass and really nice. It is 4 stories tall, with the 4th floor all being open. There is a spot to lay out and shower. This is also where they serve breakfast every morning. On the bottom floor is an outdoor pool that is surrounded by the hotel. It is smaller but very private. I never walked in or out of the place without a hotel staff sitting at the front desk. One day, they even lent an umbrella because it was raining. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “the most wonderful and peaceful experience in playa del carmen"”
Reviews.Author: joedelmar
Reviews.Content: Casa Ticul is the best option to stay in playa del carmen if what you are looking for is to be treated and feel as at home. the place is charming, the hotel personal is always looking forward to make your experience unique. you can walk to the beach or stay enjoying the beautiful swimming pool. enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in a small package”
Reviews.Author: bundteacher
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at Casa Ticul. Being on the North end of 5th Ave, it was quiet and very relaxing. The beach was close by and the rooms were clean and very comfortable. The staff were excellent in arranging anything we wanted. The breakfast was small, but acceptable, but we had to pay 3 dollars for it. We would stay here again. Try out the Uruagayan Restaurant around the corner. Great Steaks!

Reviews.Title: “caring staff and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: benjamen
Reviews.Content: this was our first time to mexico and we were'nt sure what to expect. we stayed in this hotel on our way back to cancun to catch our plane. the staff was excellent. she made sure we had a reputable ride back to the airport and helped us with info on finding a atm machine and even had pepto for my husbands upset stomach. this hotel is alittle farther down the 5th avenue strip which made it nice for a quite walk at night.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: CMOd
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great, quiet location but close to all the action and near some of the best beach area in town. The staff is absolutely wonderful, helpful, and really goes out of the way to make sure all your needs are met.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel - great value”
Reviews.Author: justin44
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel in PDC. Its definitely not central - about 4 blocks walk to central Playa del carmen but the price is fantastic and the service is unbeatable. Its perfect if you have a rental car but even if you dont the walk is very manageable. The manager - Ellisa, is wonderful and very personable. The decor is very sophisticated and well planned. The rooms are comfy - especially the beds. Another benefit is that its close to Mexico blue dream scuba shop. For the price, this place cant be beat!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a gem that will not remain undiscovered for too long.”
Reviews.Author: Thorsviks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed an excellent stay at Casa Ticul. We felt very welcomed at this quiet, charming hotel. The location was perfect for us as we enjoyed our walks around town. It is located at the eastern end of busy 5th avenue and only a couple blocks from the beach. There was a convenience store next door where we were able to purchase water and snacks at a cheap price. There is construction all around due to 5th avenue's rapid expansion and soon it will become part of the hustle and bustle. Our room was clean and decorated in a modernly spare design. Though we expected it to be a bit bigger, we found the room quite comfortable and suitable for our needs. The bed was firm but very comfortable, perfect after a long day of sightseeing. The staff was also very attentive. Maurico and Alfredo took great care of us, assisting us with booking excursions and providing great advice on dining and culture. We appreciated their kind attention and conversation. Casa Ticul helped ensure our visit to the Mayan Riviera would be a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly clean, quiet, relaxed, intimate, small and excellent location to shops, beach, resturants”
Reviews.Author: jopisces
Reviews.Content: My second stay here. I love Playa, but this little hotel feels like home. It's modern, intimate, super friendly, close to everything, great price, not touristy, close to my favorite restaurants, minutes to the beach, yoga, and quiet! The beds are huge, the morning breakfast is nice, super clean and steps from the beach and far enough away from 5th you don't have the noise. I highly recommend for business, couples, and boutique hotel lovers.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Casa Ticul
HotelInfo.Address: 5ta Avenida entre 38 y 40 | Zacil Ha, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
